Operation 'CreateMarketingList' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_input_details, missing_output_details. Original summary 'Create List' is too generic and lacks domain context. Description mentions automation UI but lacks clarity on required inputs, response structure, and how to populate the list. Enhanced version specifies this creates a 'static contacts list', clarifies input requirements, explains the response structure, and provides context about next steps (adding contacts via Contacts API).

data.current_description:
**This endpoint creates a new contacts list.**

Once you create a list, you can use the UI to [trigger an automation](https://sendgrid.com/docs/ui/sending-email/getting-started-with-automation/#create-an-automation) every time you add a new contact to the list.

A link to the newly created object is in `_metadata`.
data.summary_suggestion: Create a new marketing contacts list
data.description_suggestion: Creates a new static contacts list for Marketing Campaigns. The request body should include the list name and optional description. Returns the newly created list object with a 201 status code. The list URL is provided in the `_metadata` field. Once created, you can add contacts to this list using the Contacts API or trigger automations when new contacts are added.
data.reasoning: Original summary 'Create List' is too generic and lacks domain context. Description mentions automation UI but lacks clarity on required inputs, response structure, and how to populate the list. Enhanced version specifies this creates a 'static contacts list', clarifies input requirements, explains the response structure, and provides context about next steps (adding contacts via Contacts API).

message: Operation 'ListMarketingList' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_input_details, missing_output_details. Original summary lacks domain specificity ('Get All Lists' is generic). Description is incomplete - it doesn't mention pagination parameters, response structure, or use cases. Enhanced version specifies 'marketing contact lists', mentions pagination support, describes response structure, and provides context for when an AI agent should use this operation.

data.current_description: **This endpoint returns an array of all of your contact lists.**
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves an array of all contact lists in your Marketing Campaigns account. Supports pagination through optional parameters. Returns a list of list objects, each containing metadata such as name, creation date, contact count, and list ID. Use this operation to discover available lists before adding or managing contacts.
data.reasoning: Original summary lacks domain specificity ('Get All Lists' is generic). Description is incomplete - it doesn't mention pagination parameters, response structure, or use cases. Enhanced version specifies 'marketing contact lists', mentions pagination support, describes response structure, and provides context for when an AI agent should use this operation.

message: Operation 'UpdateMarketingList' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, vague_description, missing_input_details, missing_output_details. Original summary 'Update List' is too generic. Description is severely incomplete - it only mentions updating the name but doesn't clarify what other properties can be updated, doesn't explain input/output structure, and doesn't mention partial update support. Enhanced version clarifies updateable fields, specifies input/output requirements, explains partial update behavior, and provides context for AI agent decision-making.

data.current_description: **This endpoint updates the name of a list.**
data.summary_suggestion: Update marketing list name and properties
data.description_suggestion: Updates properties of an existing contact list, including the list name. Requires the list ID in the path and the updated properties in the request body. Returns the updated list object with a 200 status code. Only provided fields will be modified; partial updates are supported. Use this operation to rename lists or modify list metadata.
data.reasoning: Original summary 'Update List' is too generic. Description is severely incomplete - it only mentions updating the name but doesn't clarify what other properties can be updated, doesn't explain input/output structure, and doesn't mention partial update support. Enhanced version clarifies updateable fields, specifies input/output requirements, explains partial update behavior, and provides context for AI agent decision-making.

message: Operation 'DeleteMarketingList' has semantic quality issues: missing_input_details, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Summary is acceptable but description has critical gaps. It doesn't explain the default behavior (list deleted, contacts preserved), doesn't clarify response codes (204 vs 200), doesn't mention the asynchronous nature of contact deletion, and lacks warning about irreversibility. Enhanced description clarifies both deletion modes, explains response codes, emphasizes asynchronous processing, and warns about irreversibility for better AI agent understanding of consequences.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to deletes a specific list.**

Optionally, you can also delete contacts associated to the list. The query parameter, `delete_contacts=true`, will delete the list and start an asynchronous job to delete associated contacts.
data.description_suggestion: Deletes a specific contact list by ID. By default, only the list is deleted; contacts remain in your account. Set the optional query parameter `delete_contacts=true` to also delete all contacts associated with the list, which triggers an asynchronous deletion job. Returns 204 No Content on successful deletion, or 200 with status information if contacts are being deleted asynchronously. This operation cannot be undone.
data.reasoning: Summary is acceptable but description has critical gaps. It doesn't explain the default behavior (list deleted, contacts preserved), doesn't clarify response codes (204 vs 200), doesn't mention the asynchronous nature of contact deletion, and lacks warning about irreversibility. Enhanced description clarifies both deletion modes, explains response codes, emphasizes asynchronous processing, and warns about irreversibility for better AI agent understanding of consequences.

message: Operation 'DeleteContact' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_input_details, missing_output_details. Summary is clear and action-oriented. Description correctly clarifies that contacts are not deleted, but lacks critical details: it doesn't explain how to specify which contacts to remove (request body format), doesn't mention the 202 asynchronous response, and doesn't provide context for when to use this vs. deleting the list. Enhanced version specifies input format, explains asynchronous processing, and clarifies the distinction from list deletion.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to remove contacts from a given list.**

The contacts will not be deleted. Only their list membership will be changed.
data.description_suggestion: Removes one or more contacts from a specific list by list ID. The request body should contain the contact IDs to remove. Contacts are not deleted from your account; only their membership in this list is removed. Returns a 202 Accepted status, indicating the removal is being processed asynchronously. Use this operation to manage list membership without deleting contact data.
data.reasoning: Summary is clear and action-oriented. Description correctly clarifies that contacts are not deleted, but lacks critical details: it doesn't explain how to specify which contacts to remove (request body format), doesn't mention the 202 asynchronous response, and doesn't provide context for when to use this vs. deleting the list. Enhanced version specifies input format, explains asynchronous processing, and clarifies the distinction from list deletion.

Once created, you can add contacts to this list using the Contacts API or trigger automations when new contacts are added.
data.reasoning: Original summary 'Create List' is too generic and lacks domain context. Description mentions automation UI but lacks clarity on required inputs, response structure, and how to populate the list. Enhanced version specifies this creates a 'static contacts list', clarifies input requirements, explains the response structure, and provides context about next steps (adding contacts via Contacts API).

message: Operation 'DeleteMarketingList' has semantic quality issues: missing_input_details, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Summary is acceptable but description has critical gaps. It doesn't explain the default behavior (list deleted, contacts preserved), doesn't clarify response codes (204 vs 200), doesn't mention the asynchronous nature of contact deletion, and lacks warning about irreversibility. Enhanced description clarifies both deletion modes, explains response codes, emphasizes asynchronous processing, and warns about irreversibility for better AI agent understanding of consequences.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to deletes a specific list.**

Optionally, you can also delete contacts associated to the list. The query parameter, `delete_contacts=true`, will delete the list and start an asynchronous job to delete associated contacts.
data.description_suggestion: Deletes a specific contact list by ID. By default, only the list is deleted; contacts remain in your account. Set the optional query parameter `delete_contacts=true` to also delete all contacts associated with the list, which triggers an asynchronous deletion job. Returns 204 No Content on successful deletion, or 200 with status information if contacts are being deleted asynchronously. This operation cannot be undone.
data.reasoning: Summary is acceptable but description has critical gaps. It doesn't explain the default behavior (list deleted, contacts preserved), doesn't clarify response codes (204 vs 200), doesn't mention the asynchronous nature of contact deletion, and lacks warning about irreversibility. Enhanced description clarifies both deletion modes, explains response codes, emphasizes asynchronous processing, and warns about irreversibility for better AI agent understanding of consequences.

message: Operation 'DeleteContact' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_input_details, missing_output_details. Summary is clear and action-oriented. Description correctly clarifies that contacts are not deleted, but lacks critical details: it doesn't explain how to specify which contacts to remove (request body format), doesn't mention the 202 asynchronous response, and doesn't provide context for when to use this vs. deleting the list. Enhanced version specifies input format, explains asynchronous processing, and clarifies the distinction from list deletion.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to remove contacts from a given list.**

The contacts will not be deleted. Only their list membership will be changed.
data.description_suggestion: Removes one or more contacts from a specific list by list ID. The request body should contain the contact IDs to remove. Contacts are not deleted from your account; only their membership in this list is removed. Returns a 202 Accepted status, indicating the removal is being processed asynchronously. Use this operation to manage list membership without deleting contact data.
data.reasoning: Summary is clear and action-oriented. Description correctly clarifies that contacts are not deleted, but lacks critical details: it doesn't explain how to specify which contacts to remove (request body format), doesn't mention the 202 asynchronous response, and doesn't provide context for when to use this vs. deleting the list. Enhanced version specifies input format, explains asynchronous processing, and clarifies the distinction from list deletion.
